title: Great White shark weighing nearly 150 stone spotted off the coast of America

The second biggest Great White shark that has ever been tagged in the north west Atlantic has been spotted off the East Coast of America.

The predator weighs 2,076-pounds and is around 16 foot long.

The near-150 stone beast has already been named Unama'ki - a term used by indigenous people of Nova Scotia which means "land of the fog".

The female has moved further south to the Florida Keys after being spotted off the coast of Myrtle Beach in South Carolina last week.

She was also tagged by experts off the North Carolina coast, Virginia Beach and off Atlantic City in New Jersey, it has been revealed.

(Image: OCEARCH/R.Sno)

(Image: OCEARCH/R.Sno)

OCEARCH, the non-profit marine life organisation, are excited by the news.

"As a big mature female, Unama'ki has the potential to lead us to the site where she gives birth and exposes a new white shark nursery," they said.

Worried locals have been reminded that shark attacks are rare.

But The Florida Fish and Wildlife Conservation Commission has told those planning to use the beach to take no risks.

They say the ocean "more than likely contain sharks" at this time of the year.

(Image: OCEARCH/R.Sno)

But they added: "Shark activity is at its peak in Florida waters during April through October.

"However, shark attacks are still rare, with humans being 30 times more likely to be struck by lightning in Florida than to be bitten by a shark."

The FWC urges "visitors to be aware of their surroundings and understand the risks they take swimming in the waters".
description: It is the second biggest ever tagged in the north west Atlantic after the 16-foot creature was seen off Florida Keys
